config_description: /** * Database setting DROP_RESTRICT (default: true) * Whether the default action for DROP TABLE, DROP VIEW, DROP SCHEMA, DROP * DOMAIN, and DROP CONSTRAINT is RESTRICT. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration DROP_RESTRICT is used to determine the default action for dropping tables, views, schemas, domains, and constraints. If the setting is true, the action is set to RESTRICT, otherwise it is set to CASCADE.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the DROP_RESTRICT configuration depends on how often tables, views, schemas, domains, and constraints are dropped in the system. If these operations are frequent, then the configuration will be triggered more often.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the DROP_RESTRICT configuration option is significant as it determines the default action for dropping database objects. If set to RESTRICT, it restricts the drop operation if there are dependencies, whereas if set to CASCADE, it cascades the drop operation to dependent objects. This can have implications on data integrity and system behavior.
